artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Sasaki Toyokichi; Carver: Wada Yūjirō
creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
description: seated man with stubble sits in wide stance with sword in PL hand and PR hand on PR knee fiercely staring to the R; seated on red and blue cushion; sliding screens painted with reeds and a moon with two pulls (resembling eyes) over his PR shoulder; glowing lantern in back with inscription
inscription: LL margin, in red, Japanese inscription; URC, in cartouche, Japanese inscription; Japanese inscription center of upper margin
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and colors on paper
portfolio: From New Forms of Thirty-Six Ghosts (Shinkei sanjūrokkaisen 新形三十六怪撰)
text: Second variation of first edition. The first variation has also blue in the print title cartouche. The second edition was produced by Daikokuya Heikichi in 1902.
title: Kiyomori Sees Hundreds of Skulls at Fukuhara
